verses.roman:
yadyapi sahasā āmi kariyāchi sannyāsa
tathāpi tomā-sabā haite nahiba udāsa

synonyms: yadyapi—although; sahasā—all of a sudden; āmi—I; kariyāchi sannyāsa—accepted sannyāsa; tathāpi—still; tomā-sabā—all of you; haite—from; nahiba—I shall never be; udāsa—indifferent.
translation: "My dear friends, although I have suddenly accepted this renounced order, I still know that I shall never be indifferent to you.
